definitions: having never lost in competition or conflict
not subjected to physical beating or striking
not thoroughly mixed or whipped as in cooking
examples: The unbeaten team advanced to the championship finals
Their unbeaten record stretched across twenty consecutive games
The unbeaten path through the forest remained pristine
The unbeaten metal retained its original smooth surface
The unbeaten eggs floated on top of the mixture
Leave the cream unbeaten for a lighter texture

definitions: not attractive or flattering in appearance or style
not suitable or proper for a person's position or character
examples: That unbecoming dress made her look much older
The harsh lighting was unbecoming to everyone in the room
Such unbecoming behavior shocked the entire committee
His unbecoming remarks damaged his professional reputation

definitions: happening or existing without someone's knowledge or awareness
examples: Unbeknown to her parents, she had already left town
The treasure lay unbeknown beneath the old oak tree

definitions: happening or existing without the knowledge of someone specified
examples: Unbeknownst to the staff, major changes were being planned
She had been watching him, unbeknownst to everyone else

definitions: so remarkable or extreme as to be difficult to believe
too improbable or unlikely to be believed as true
examples: The concert was unbelievable in its musical perfection
She achieved unbelievable success in just three years
His unbelievable excuse fooled nobody at the meeting
The story seemed unbelievable even to sympathetic listeners

definitions: showing no prejudice or favoritism toward particular opinions or sides
examples: The unbiased judge carefully considered all the evidence
We need an unbiased opinion from someone outside the company

definitions: still in the womb; not yet brought into existence
examples: Laws protecting the rights of unborn children sparked debate
She worried about the effects on her unborn baby

definitions: not fastened, tied, or restrained by bonds or restraints
free from limits, restrictions, or control
not having pages fastened together as in bookbinding
examples: The unbound prisoner finally escaped from the dungeon
Her unbound hair flowed freely in the wind
His unbound creativity produced revolutionary artistic works
The unbound energy of youth filled the playground
The unbound manuscript pages scattered across the floor
She preferred unbound notebooks for her sketching

definitions: having no boundaries or limits in extent, quantity, or scope
examples: Her unbounded enthusiasm inspired the entire team
The universe seemed to offer unbounded possibilities

definitions: having no branches or offshoots from the main stem or structure
examples: The unbranched trunk rose straight toward the canopy
This unbranched polymer chain has unique chemical properties

definitions: impossible to break or damage through physical force
impossible to overcome, defeat, or weaken in spirit
examples: The unbreakable glass withstood even the strongest impacts
These unbreakable dishes are perfect for outdoor dining
Their unbreakable bond survived decades of separation
She showed unbreakable determination throughout her recovery

definitions: not controlled or restrained; showing no restraint in expression
examples: His unbridled enthusiasm sometimes overwhelmed his colleagues
The crowd erupted in unbridled joy after the victory

definitions: remaining whole and intact without damage or fracture
continuing without interruption or pause in time or sequence
not subdued or tamed, especially of animals
examples: The unbroken vase survived the earthquake remarkably well
All the windows remained unbroken despite the storm
She maintained unbroken concentration for three hours straight
Their unbroken winning streak lasted two full seasons
The unbroken horse bucked wildly in the corral
These unbroken lands have never known human cultivation

definitions: strange or mysterious in an unsettling way that seems supernatural
examples: She had an uncanny ability to predict the weather
The resemblance between the twins was absolutely uncanny

definitions: having no cap, lid, or covering on top
having no upper limit or maximum restriction
examples: The uncapped pen leaked ink all over the document
Several uncapped bottles sat dangerously on the shelf
The plan offers uncapped data usage for premium customers
Uncapped bonuses motivated the sales team significantly

definitions: showing no concern, sympathy, or consideration for others
examples: His uncaring attitude hurt his family deeply
The uncaring response from authorities angered the community

definitions: not subjected to censorship; containing all original content unedited
examples: The uncensored version revealed shocking additional footage
They published the uncensored letters after fifty years

definitions: not able to be relied on as true or definite
feeling doubt about something; not confident or sure
examples: The uncertain weather made planning outdoor events difficult
The outcome remains uncertain pending further investigation
She felt uncertain about accepting the job offer
He looked uncertain when asked about his plans

definitions: released from chains or similar physical restraints
examples: The unchained prisoners finally walked to freedom
The unchained dog ran joyfully through the yard

definitions: not disputed, questioned, or doubted by anyone
not opposed or contested in competition or conflict
examples: Her expertise went unchallenged throughout the conference
These unchallenged assumptions need careful examination
The champion remained unchallenged for five consecutive years
They crossed the border unchallenged by the guards

definitions: remaining the same; not altered or modified in any way
examples: The policy remained unchanged despite public protests
Her appearance was unchanged after twenty years

definitions: remaining the same over time; showing no variation or alteration
examples: The unchanging desert landscape stretched for miles
His unchanging routine provided comfort and stability

definitions: not typical or usual for a particular person or thing
examples: His uncharacteristic silence worried his friends greatly
The team showed uncharacteristic nervousness before the match

definitions: not recorded on a map or chart
not yet explored or experienced; completely unknown
examples: The expedition ventured into uncharted wilderness regions
Ancient sailors feared uncharted waters beyond known lands
They entered uncharted territory with their innovative research
Starting this business meant navigating uncharted waters

definitions: not examined, inspected, or verified for accuracy or quality
allowed to continue or increase without restraint or control
examples: The unchecked data contained numerous serious errors
Several unchecked items passed through security
Unchecked population growth strained the city's resources
The disease spread unchecked through the community

definitions: not having developed social organization or cultural refinement
behaving in a rude, crude, or socially unacceptable manner
examples: The explorers encountered uncivilized tribes in remote areas
Life without modern amenities seemed uncivilized to them
His uncivilized behavior at dinner shocked the guests
Such uncivilized conduct won't be tolerated here

definitions: not collected or requested by an owner or entitled person
examples: Unclaimed luggage filled the airport's lost property office
Millions in unclaimed lottery prizes expire each year

definitions: not arranged in or assigned to categories or classes
not designated as secret or confidential in security terms
examples: These unclassified specimens await proper scientific analysis
The unclassified data needs sorting before processing
The unclassified documents can be shared publicly
Only unclassified information appeared in the report

definitions: covered with dirt, germs, or unwanted substances
morally wrong or corrupt according to ethical standards
ceremonially impure according to religious law or custom
examples: The unclean surfaces harbored dangerous bacteria
Workers refused to use the unclean facilities
His unclean thoughts troubled his conscience deeply
They condemned such unclean practices
Certain foods were considered unclean by religious law
The unclean spirits were cast out

definitions: difficult to see, hear, or understand distinctly
uncertain or confused about something in one's mind
examples: The instructions were unclear and confusing to follow
The image became unclear after multiple photocopies
She remained unclear about the meeting's actual purpose
He seemed unclear when explaining his intentions

definitions: not gathered, picked up, or assembled from various places
examples: Uncollected mail piled up during their vacation
The uncollected taxes created budget shortfalls

definitions: causing or feeling physical discomfort or mild pain
causing or feeling psychological unease, awkwardness, or anxiety
examples: The uncomfortable chairs made the meeting seem endless
These shoes are too uncomfortable to wear all day
The uncomfortable silence stretched between them awkwardly
She felt uncomfortable discussing her personal finances

definitions: not pledged or bound to a particular cause, policy, or course
not showing dedication or emotional investment in something
examples: The uncommitted delegates could swing the nomination
Several uncommitted nations remained neutral
He seemed uncommitted to the relationship's success
Their uncommitted approach yielded mediocre results

definitions: not occurring, found, or done often; relatively rare
remarkably great or intense in degree or extent
examples: Such talent is uncommon in someone so young
Uncommon birds occasionally visit this nature reserve
She showed uncommon bravery during the crisis
His uncommon wisdom impressed everyone present

definitions: unable to compete successfully against others in quality or price
examples: Their uncompetitive prices drove customers to rivals
The uncompetitive team finished last in the league

definitions: not brought to a conclusion or finished state
examples: The uncompleted building stood abandoned for years
Several uncompleted tasks remained on her desk

definitions: easy to understand or deal with; not complex or elaborate
examples: The uncomplicated recipe required only three ingredients
She preferred an uncomplicated lifestyle without drama

definitions: unwilling to make concessions or accept less than one's standards
examples: Her uncompromising stance on quality improved the product
The uncompromising leader refused all negotiations

definitions: showing no anxiety or interest; not worried about something
examples: He seemed unconcerned about the approaching deadline
The cat remained unconcerned by the loud noises

definitions: not subject to any conditions, limitations, or restrictions
examples: Parents often give unconditional love to their children
The treaty required unconditional surrender from both sides

definitions: not yet proven to be true or officially validated
examples: Unconfirmed reports suggested major changes were coming
The unconfirmed diagnosis required additional testing

definitions: having no physical link or attachment to something else
having no relationship or association with something else
examples: The unconnected wires dangled from the ceiling
Several unconnected computer terminals sat idle
These seemingly unconnected events formed a pattern
Her comments were unconnected to the main topic

definitions: not overcome, defeated, or brought under control by force
examples: The unconquered territory remained fiercely independent
Her unconquered spirit inspired others to persevere

definitions: shockingly unfair or unreasonable; contrary to conscience or morality
examples: The unconscionable delay caused unnecessary suffering
Charging such unconscionable prices during emergencies is wrong

definitions: not combined or merged into a single unified whole
consisting of loose sediment that has not been cemented together
examples: The unconsolidated departments operated independently
Several unconsolidated loans complicated their finances
Unconsolidated sediments covered the ancient bedrock
The unconsolidated soil shifted easily during construction

definitions: not in accordance with or violating the principles of a constitution
examples: The court ruled the law unconstitutional and void
Such unconstitutional actions threatened democratic principles

definitions: not limited or restricted in action, expression, or extent
examples: The artist's unconstrained creativity produced masterful works
Unconstrained spending led to serious financial problems

definitions: not disputed or challenged; accepted without opposition
examples: She won the uncontested election by default
The facts remained uncontested throughout the trial

definitions: impossible to control, restrain, or manage effectively
examples: Uncontrollable laughter erupted throughout the audience
The fire became uncontrollable within minutes

definitions: not regulated or governed by any controlling force or authority
not restrained or held in check; allowed to proceed freely
examples: Uncontrolled development destroyed the natural habitat
The uncontrolled experiment produced unreliable results
His uncontrolled anger frightened everyone present
Uncontrolled bleeding required immediate medical attention
